excess.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a larger amount of something than is allowed or needed
excess.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: After you apply the oil, wait 20 minutes before wiping off any excess.
It was an excess of enthusiasm that caused the problem.
excess.translation[0].definitions[1].def: behaviour which is not acceptable because it is too extreme
excess.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: a long sermon against the dangers of excess
excess.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: He lived through some of the worst excesses of apartheid in South Africa.
The Press Complaints Commission criticized the wilder excesses of tabloid journalism.
A strong press can help to curb the excesses of government.
The excesses committed by a small number of soldiers have ruined the regiment's good name.
Government forces used the situation as an excuse to perpetrate excesses against suspected rebels.
excess.translation[1].definitions[0].def: additional and not needed because there is already enough of something
excess.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Cut any excess fat from the meat.
excess.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a larger amount of something than is allowed or needed
excess.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: He told the Federal Assembly that the devaluation would compensate for an excess in public spending during the past nine months.
excess.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: ships carrying in excess of 20,000 tonnes of cargo
excess.translation[2].definitions[2].def: a condition in an insurance policy that states that the insured person will pay a particular amount towards any damage and the insurance company will pay the rest. This condition makes people less likely to claim for small amounts
excess.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: The insurance company will pay the insured value less the policy excess.
excess.translation[3].definitions[0].def: additional and not wanted or needed because there is already enough of something
excess.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: An excess supply of goods and services on the market will exert downward pressure on prices.
excess.translation[3].definitions[1].def: bags or cases that weigh more than the limit the airline allows you to take on a plane
excess.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: As I checked in at Baghdad airport, I found that I had 100kg of excess baggage.
